author: Sébastien Larivière

text: such a good OST. It's interesting how polarizing CC as a game is/was. many vocal fans of CT seems to loathe it but I really loved CC right away, and I'm a huge CT fan (played it when it came out in 1995). It has a very dream-like quality to it. The plot is a convoluted spin-off of CT but the basic premise of CC is very universal: what if you made a different decision 10 years ago? what if you ceased to exist? how would things have turned out differently (for everyone)?
author: Tristan MacLeod

text: Best sound track for a game ever!! Amazon should have it available.
author: Eric Edwards

text: You're not alone in that world, sir.
author: goodsideevilside

text: You understand exactly why video game music in general appeals to me. Many others have laughed about my tastes over the years, but I don't think anything strange of it. The right soundtrack can transport you to a new world. Listening to this, I feel like I am in the world of Chrono Cross, and I remember the good times I've had playing it nonstop. I love feeling like I'm a part of such a magical world.

That's how you know a piece of music is good.

text:
It's good, don't get me wrong. My 5/5 tracks, off the cuff:

Time's Scar
Beach of Dreams
Reminiscing
Lost Fragments
Prisoners of Fate
Garden of the Gods
Radical Dreamers - Unstolen Jewel

There may be others, but those i know were keepers for sure.
